'British Sky Broadcasting Group PLC' (commonly known as 'BSkyB'; trading as
'Sky') is a British satellite broadcasting, broadband and telephone services
company headquartered in London, with operations in the UK and Ireland. Formed
in 1990 by the equal merger of Sky Television and British Satellite
Broadcasting, BSkyB is the largest pay-TV broadcaster in the UK and Ireland with
over 10 million subscribers.

BSkyB is listed on the London Stock Exchange and is a constituent of the FTSE
100 Index. It had a market capitalisation of approximately Â£11.47 billion
(US$18 billion) as of 20 June 2012 on the London Stock Exchange. 21st
Century Fox owns a 39.14 per cent controlling stake in the company.
